intro: Chrysobotrya revoluta, commonly known as the Revolute Chrysobotrya, is a species of flowering plant in the family Euphorbiaceae. It is native to South Africa, where it typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils. The plant features small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, and its leaves are usually ovate with a distinctive revolute margin. It is often found in arid or semi-arid environments, adapting to harsh climatic conditions. Due to its unique morphology and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
